mods.abstract: Seated male figure roughly three quarter turned to the picture plane with legs crossed and left hand uplifted. Right arm is severed approximately four inches below elbow. Figure has mexican-Indian features composed of long nose, thick lips, straight hair and is emaciated. The figure is dressed in rags and sits on pavement.
mods.note: Another copy from the same edition Acc. No. 2001.3.65

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
